sen.j: 田中大秀（たなか おおひで、安永6年8月15日 (旧暦)（1777年9月16日） - 弘化4年9月16日 (旧暦)（1847年10月24日））は、江戸時代後期の日本の国学者。
sen.e: Ohide TANAKA (b. September 16, 1777 – d. October 24, 1847) was a scholar of Japanese classical literature from the late Edo period.
Ohide TANAKA (September 16, 1777 – October 24, 1847) was a scholar of Japanese classical literature from the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: ルールに則っていない独自フォーマットの生年・没年表記のため、修正しました.
sen.e: Ohide TANAKA (September 16, 1777 – October 24, 1847) was a scholar of Japanese classical literature from the late Edo period.

sen.j: 飛騨国高山市 一之町の薬種商田中屋の三男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the third son to the owner of second-class drug seller Tanaka-ya in Ichinomachi, Takayama City, Hida Province.
He was born as the third son to the owner of second-class drug seller Tanaka-ya in Ichinomachi, Takayama City, Hida Province.
He was born as the third son to the owner of second-class drug seller Tanaka-ya in Ichinomachi, Takayama City, Hida Province.

sen.j: 初名は紀文（としぶみ）・大秀・八月麿。
sen.e: His original names were Toshibumi, Ohide and Hachigatsumaro.

sen.e: His azana (Chinese courtesy name which was, historically, the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations; scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Juho.

sen.e: His azana (Chinese courtesy name which was, historically, the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations; scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Juho.

sen.j: 号 (称号)は千種園・賞月榭・湯津香木園（ゆつかつらぞの、屋号でもある）・荏野翁（えなのおきな）。

His second names were Senshuen, Shogetusha, Yutsukatsurazono (also the name of the store) and Enanookina.

sen.j: 通称は、弥次郎・弥兵衛・兵助。
sen.e: Common names he was called were Yajiro, Yahei and Heisuke.
His common names were Yajiro, Yahei and Heisuke.

sen.j: 父は弥兵衛博道。
sen.e: His father was Yahei Hiromichi.
His father was Yahei Hiromichi.

sen.j: 田中家は商売以外にも冬頭村（ふいとむら、現岐阜県高山市冬頭町）に所有する広大な田畑を小作人に貸し与えており、経済的に恵まれた環境であった。
sen.e: In addition to owning a business, the Tanaka family rented the vast fields they owned in Fuito Village (currently Fuito Town, Takayama City, Gifu Prefecture) to tenant farmers, therefore were financially quite well off.

In addition to running a business, the Tanaka family rented the vast fields they owned in Fuito Village (currently Fuito-cho, Takayama City, Gifu Prefecture) to tenant farmers, therefore the family was financially quite well-off.
sen.cmt: 「商売」を「own」とはあまり言いませんし、土地を所有すると繰り返し利用になりますので、「run」を用いました。「町」をルールにのっとり修正しました。田中家の単数形に対しbe動詞が複数形です。訂正しました。恵まれたの意味の「well off」は「well-off」とダッシュでつながれるのが通常です。修正しました。
sen.e: In addition to running a business, the Tanaka family rented the vast fields they owned in Fuito Village (currently Fuito-cho, Takayama City, Gifu Prefecture) to tenant farmers, therefore the family was financially quite well-off.

sen.j: 幼少の頃より学問を好み、はじめ熱田神宮神官の粟田知周や歌人 伴蒿蹊に学ぶ。
sen.e: Ohide enjoyed his studies from a young age, and first studied under the priest Tomochika AWATA of Atsuta-jingu Shrine and poet Kokei BAN.
Since his childhood, Ohide liked studying and he studied under the priest Tomochika AWATA of Atsuta-jingu Shrine and poet Kokei BAN in earlier days.
sen.cmt: 幼少の頃よりの訳「from a young age」は不定冠詞用法など誤りがあります。修正しました。
sen.e: Since his childhood, Ohide liked studying and he studied under the priest Tomochika AWATA of Atsuta-jingu Shrine and poet Kokei BAN in earlier days.

sen.j: 享和元年（1801年）4月、23歳のとき厄のため伊勢神宮に参拝。
sen.e: He visited Ise-jingu Shrine in April 1801 at the age of 23 in order to ward off bad luck.
In April 1801 when he was 23 years old, he visited Ise-jingu Shrine in order to ward off a bad spirit.
sen.cmt: 厄払いの訳修正、及び年齢表記などを修正しました。
sen.e: In April 1801 when he was 23 years old, he visited Ise-jingu Shrine in order to ward off a bad spirit.

sen.j: その途次、京都滞在中の本居宣長を訪問。
sen.e: He used the opportunity to visit Norinaga MOTOORI who was staying in Kyoto at the time.
He used the opportunity to visit Norinaga MOTOORI who was staying in Kyoto at the time.
He used the opportunity to visit Norinaga MOTOORI who was staying in Kyoto at the time.

sen.j: 即座に入門を果たしそのまま2ヶ月程度、宣長の講釈を熱心に受ける。
sen.e: Ohide instantly became Norinaga's disciple, listening enthusiastically to his narrations for the following two months.
Ohide was instantly accepted to become the disciple of Norinaga, and he eagerly listened to the lecture of Norinaga for the following two months.
sen.cmt: 「入門を果たす」の意味は、「入学の許可を得た」という意味になるよう修正しました。「講釈」は一般的な「lecture」としました。
sen.e: Ohide was instantly accepted to become the disciple of Norinaga, and he eagerly listened to the lecture of Norinaga for the following two months.

sen.j: 帰郷後まもなく宣長の訃報に接した。
sen.e: Soon after his return home, he was told of Norinaga's passing.
Soon after he returned to home, he received the news of Norinaga's death.
sen.cmt: 前置詞を追加しました。わかりやすくするため一般的なフレーズに修正しました。
sen.e: Soon after he returned to home, he received the news of Norinaga's death.

sen.j: 宣長の嗣子 本居大平は生涯の師友となった。
sen.e: Norinaga's heir Ohira MOTOORI became Ohide's friend and teacher for life.
Norinaga's heir Ohira MOTOORI became Ohide's friend and teacher throughout his life.
sen.cmt: 「生涯の」の意味がわかりやすくなるよう修正しました。
sen.e: Norinaga's heir Ohira MOTOORI became Ohide's friend and teacher throughout his life.

sen.j: 享和3年（1803年）、兄 休明（よしあき）が夭折したため、26歳で家督を継いだ。
sen.e: Due to his brother Yoshiaki's premature death in 1803, he took over the family estate at the age of 26.
Due to the premature death of his elder brother Yoshiaki in 1803, he took over the headship of the family at the age of 26.
sen.cmt: 「兄」であることがわかるように修正しました。家督について、headship ofを追加しました。
sen.e: Due to the premature death of his elder brother Yoshiaki in 1803, he took over the headship of the family at the age of 26.

sen.j: 大秀は和歌に長じ、書も能くし、篳篥や琴にも才能を発揮した。
sen.e: Ohide was skilled with waka (poetry) and calligraphy, and also showed talents for the hichiriki flute and koto.
Ohide was skilled with Waka (a Japanese poem form) and calligraphy, and even showed talents for the hichiriki (Japanese traditional recorder) and koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings).
sen.cmt: 和歌の訳が「poetry」のみの説明でしたので追記しました。篳篥をfluteとしていますが、篳篥は縦笛でfluteは横笛を指しますので訂正しました。琴の説明を追加しました。
sen.e: Ohide was skilled with Waka (a Japanese poem form) and calligraphy, and even showed talents for the hichiriki (Japanese traditional recorder) and koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings).

sen.j: 文化5年（1808年）、琴士玉堂と名乗っていた浦上玉堂が高山の大秀を訪ねた記録がみられる。
sen.e: There is a record that shows that Gyokudo URAGAMI, who called himself Kinji (Koto player) URAGAMI, visited Ohide in Takayama in 1808.
A record describes that Gyokudo URAGAMI, who called himself Kinji (Koto player) URAGAMI, visited Ohide living in Takayama in 1808.
sen.cmt: thatが連続し読みづらいため、関係代名詞の方を削除する語順に修正しました。
sen.e: A record describes that Gyokudo URAGAMI, who called himself Kinji (Koto player) URAGAMI, visited Ohide living in Takayama in 1808.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)15年（1818年）、41歳のとき長子に家督を譲り隠居。
sen.e: In 1818 at the age of 41, Ohide passed the reigns of the family onto his eldest child in order to retire.
In 1818, when he was 41 years old, Ohide passed the headship of the family onto his eldest child in order to retire.
sen.cmt: Inで始まる分節が文法的に正しくないため修正しました。家督の訳をより一般的なものに修正しました。
sen.e: In 1818, when he was 41 years old, Ohide passed the headship of the family onto his eldest child in order to retire.

sen.j: 同年、「稲置（いなき）の森」にある祠堂を『延喜式』にその名がみえる荏名神社と同定し、これを再興。
sen.e: That same year, he identified the Shido (hall dedicated to the souls of ancestors) located in 'Inaki Forest' as Ena-jinja Shrine which can be found in "the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), and restored it.

In the same year, he identified and restored the Shido (hall dedicated to the souls of ancestors) located in 'Inaki Forest' as Ena-jinja Shrine described in "the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).
sen.cmt: That same yearに意味付けを行う前置詞が無いため追加しました。関係代名詞を削除し文章を簡略化しました。
sen.e: In the same year, he identified and restored the Shido (hall dedicated to the souls of ancestors) located in 'Inaki Forest' as Ena-jinja Shrine described in "the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).

sen.j: 本殿の傍らに隠棲し荏野翁と称し、国学の研究と後進の育成に専念した。
sen.e: He called himself Enanookina and moved in to the side of the honden (main hall), and dedicating himself to the study Japanese literature and culture as well as the education of future generations in the subject.

He moved to the small building next to the honden (main hall) and called himself as Enanookina; he dedicated himself to the study of Japanese literature and culture, as well as the education of the future generations.
sen.cmt: 「and dedicating himself」の文法を訂正しました。荏野翁と称した根拠は荏名神社の傍らに隠棲したためと思われますので、それを示すよう語順を修正しました。教育については特定の科目など示されていませんので、単に後進の育成を行ったという意味に省略しました。
sen.e: He moved to the small building next to the honden (main hall) and called himself as Enanookina; he dedicated himself to the study of Japanese literature and culture, as well as the education of the future generations.

sen.j: 文政3年（1820年）、平安時代に造営され中世以降荒廃していた飛騨総社を再興する。
sen.e: In 1820, he restored Hida-sosha Shrine which had been build in the Heian Period and had fallen into disrepair since the Medieval Period.
In 1820, he restored Hida-sosha Shrine which had been build in the Heian Period and had fallen into disrepair since the Medieval Period.
In 1820, he restored Hida-sosha Shrine which had been build in the Heian Period and had fallen into disrepair since the Medieval Period.

sen.j: 天保から弘化にかけて幾度か隣国 越前（越前大野・勝山・福井・敦賀）を訪問し、橘曙覧をはじめ多くの門弟を育てた。
sen.e: From the Tenpo era (1830-1844) and into Koka era (1844-1848) he visited the neighboring Echizen Province (Echizen-Ono, Katsuyama, Fukui, Tsuruga) and educated many disciples including TACHIBANA no Akemi.

From the Tenpo era (1830-1844) and into Koka era (1844-1848) he visited the neighboring Echizen Province (Echizen-Ono, Katsuyama, Fukui, Tsuruga) and educated many disciples including TACHIBANA no Akemi.

From the Tenpo era (1830-1844) and into Koka era (1844-1848) he visited the neighboring Echizen Province (Echizen-Ono, Katsuyama, Fukui, Tsuruga) and educated many disciples including TACHIBANA no Akemi.

sen.j: 弘化3年（1846年）、越前国（福井県）に招かれ、45年前に宣長から受けた万葉集講釈（鈴屋万葉講説）に自説を交えて講釈した。
sen.e: In 1846 he was invited to Echizen Province (currently Fukui Prefecture) and narrated the Manyoshu (Suzuya Manyo Kosetsu) as he had been taught by Norinaga 45 years earlier, mixed with his own stories.

In 1846 he was invited to Echizen Province (currently Fukui Prefecture) and gave lecture about the Manyoshu (Suzuya Manyo Kosetsu) as he had been taught by Norinaga 45 years ago, along with his own theories.
sen.cmt: 「講釈した」はより一般的な「gave lecture」としました。自説、交えてなどの言い方を修正しました。
sen.e: In 1846 he was invited to Echizen Province (currently Fukui Prefecture) and gave lecture about the Manyoshu (Suzuya Manyo Kosetsu) as he had been taught by Norinaga 45 years ago, along with his own theories.

sen.e: Ohide died in 1847.

Ohide died in 1847.

sen.j: 法号 松室了郭居士・諡号 豊美豆穏八束垂穂大人。

His posthumous Buddhist name was Muromatsu Ryokaku Koji, and posthumous title was Toyomitoonyatsukatarihonoushi.

sen.j: 荏名神社から南方に大きな松が生い茂る丘があるが、大秀は松室岡（むろまつおか）と名付け、生前から自らの墓地と定めていた。
sen.e: There is a hill with a large pine tree to the south of Ena-jinja Shrine which Ohide named Muromatsu-oka Hill (matsu = pine) and had designated to be his grave.

sen.e: There is a hill with a large pine tree to the south of Ena-jinja Shrine, which Ohide named Muromatsu-oka Hill (matsu = pine) and designated to his graveyard.

sen.j: ここにある石碑には自らの筆跡で「田中大秀之奥城」と刻まれ、その後方の小円墳に大秀が葬られている。
sen.e: There is a stone monument here with the engraving 'Ohide TANAKA's Grave' in his own hand, and Ohide is buried in a small round mound behind the monument.
There is a stone monument on the hill, engraved as 'Ohide TANAKA's Grave' in his own hand writing, while Ohide is buried in a small circular shaped mound behind the monument.
sen.cmt: hereをthereに置き換えました。前方後円墳などに用いられる一般訳を当てはめました。
sen.e: There is a stone monument on the hill, engraved as 'Ohide TANAKA's Grave' in his own hand writing, while Ohide is buried in a small circular shaped mound behind the monument.

sen.j: 今日よりは 我まつむろに 蔭しめて ちよのみどりを 友とたのまむ 荏野翁

sen.j: 研究においても、宣長の『古事記伝』の流れを汲み、緻密で博識であった。

sen.cmt: draw bridgeは城壁などに懸ける橋ですのでbascule bridgeとしました。読みやすくなるよう語順を変更しました。
sen.e: Today, there remains the design drawing for a bascule bridge (Sacred Bridge of Ena-jinja Shrine) (1844) produced by Ohide.
